bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 163, Number 36 (Wednesday, March 1, 2017)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. KRISHNAMOORTHI:H.R. 1287.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The authority to offer this bill derives from Article 1,Section 8, Clause 18, of the US Constitution.[Page H1464]

item.latestTitle: Higher Education Reform and Opportunity Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

item.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

item.text:
Executive Order Transparency Act

This bill requires the President to publish an executive order on the White House website at least 72 hours before signing such order.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Executive Order Transparency Act

item.title: To require that any Executive order be published on the White House website not less than 72 hours before the Executive order is signed.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
